entry.title: There’s A Proposal To Decentralize Cardano Physical Infrastructure: Will ADA Prices Push Higher?
entry.summary:
Cardano is one of the largest blockchains and among the first to use the proof-of-stake consensus algorithm. While the network has been slipping away from the top 10, it remains one of the most decentralized platforms. Pooltool data shows that Cardano has over 2,800 stake pools (or validators) when writing on October 16.
To maintain this level of decentralization, stake pool operators must run nodes and maintain a high uptime, over 99%, to avoid penalties. This is often achieved using centralized cloud service providers like Google, Amazon, and others.
Developer Proposes To Decentralize Computing Resource Using Physical Infrastructure
A proposal now aims to decentralize the physical computing infrastructure, ensuring that stake pool operators don’t spend cash on centralized soluti…

entry.title: Ireland Catching Up with EU Deadline: Urgently Drafting Crypto Laws
entry.summary: Irish lawmakers are urgently preparing legislation covering digital assets and crypto firms ahead of the broader European Union’s anti-money laundering and terror financing laws, set to be enacted on 30 December 2024. According to a report by the Irish Examiner, Ireland’s Finance Minister, Jack Chambers, has already asked the cabinet to draft this urgent law, as the country needs to update its regulations before the European bloc's deadline. EU Moves Ahead with Crypto Laws The 27-country European bloc’s Anti-Money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism Act covers crypto transactions. However, it differs from the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation (MiCA), which partially came into effect earlier this year, with its remaining provisions set to be enforced by the end of 2024. W…

entry.title: Hong Kong Police Take Down $46 Million Romance Crypto Scam—Here’s How
entry.summary:
Hong Kong authorities have dismantled a HK$360 million ($46.3 million) cryptocurrency-based romance fraud scheme in a significant crackdown on fraud operations.
This scheme, which targeted individuals over a year, reportedly lured victims into investing in cryptocurrencies under the guise of online romantic relationships.
Detailing The Scheme And The Seizure
The operation, codenamed “Secret Word,” culminated in the arrest of 27 suspects who allegedly masterminded the fraud and swindled unsuspecting individuals from Hong Kong and other countries, including India, Singapore, and Malaysia.
The Hong Kong police deployed over 100 officers to investigate and conduct an onsite raid, seizing over HK$200,000 ($25,742) in cash, luxury watches, and other valuables.
Among the items confisc…

entry.summary:
Dogecoin has just witnessed a rally of around 10% after on-chain data signaled a mass exodus of holders from the DOGE network.
Dogecoin Has Seen A Jump Of Almost 12% Over The Past Day
This week has brought bullish winds in the cryptocurrency sector as a whole, but among the top coins, one asset in particular has stood out: Dogecoin. The meme-based token has managed to surpass the $0.127 level after registering an uplift of nearly 12% during the last 24 hours.
For perspective, Bitcoin (BTC) is up around 4% in the same window, while Shiba Inu (SHIB), DOGE’s rival-coin, is up about 5%. The asset has also performed well in terms of weekly returns, with only Bitcoin Cash (BCH) with its 12% returns coming close to DOGE’s 14% profits.
The DOGE market cap has now grown to $18.5 bill…

entry.title: October Crypto Shock: Phishing Scams Drain $41 Million From Victims
entry.summary:
A whopping $41 million has been lost in October so far due to the increasing influx of phishing attacks. Most of the phishing operations within the crypto space usually involve engaging users in signing actions through their crypto wallets, to approve contracts or linking permissions.
Making false tokens that look like real wallet tokens is one typical phishing method used to pilfer cryptocurrencies from victims’ wallets. Particularly harmful is permit phishing since it lets several highly valuable tokens be transferred simultaneously.
3 hours ago, another victim lost $1.57M after signing a “permit” phishing signature. pic.twitter.com/wDGZIMdJ7N
— Scam Sniffer | Web3 Anti-Scam (@realScamSniffer) October 15, 2024
Phishing: Hackers Getting Smarter
An example is a wallet bre…

entry.title: $7.5 Million In Bitcoin, ETH, XRP Powers Trump’s Latest Campaign Efforts
entry.summary:
A political action committee supporting former President Donald Trump has raised approximately $7.5 million in crypto donations since early June, according to a recent filing with the Federal Election Commission. The Trump 47 joint fundraising committee received contributions in Bitcoin, Ether, XRP, as well as stablecoins Tether and USD Coin.
The latest filing, submitted on Tuesday, covers donations from July 1 through September 30 and includes cumulative contributions. This huge amount of crypto donations confirms the previous data, which confirmed that the industry is betting heavily on Trump, with the US election only three weeks away.
Bitcoin And Crypto Donations Bolster Trump Campaign
Trump, who previously expressed skepticism toward Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies during his presi…

entry.summary: Nils Anderson Röed, the exchange’s global head of financial investigations, sat down with Decrypt’s Sander Lutz at Messari Mainnet 2024 to discuss how Binance is proactively dismantling criminal networks around the world, the strategy with which the crypto exchange is approaching sensitive conflicts in the Middle East, and more.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 212 - SEEDPHRASE TALKS ART!
entry.summary: Payrolls Higher than expected, Bitcoin reacts hard. Crypto sank early in the week as Middle East tensions spooked markets. Powell signals two more rate cuts this year. SUI leads L1s again, nears YTD high despite large unlock. Majority of FTX repayments still months away. EIGEN becomes non-transferable, hits $6bn FDV. SEC to appeal Ripple securities law ruling. Visa launches tokenization platform for banks. SWIFT plans digital asset trial in 2025. ByBit launched trading of global stock indices. SPX, GIGA & FWOG hit ATHs, most memes fall. XCOPY to release 250 piece collection on Shape. HBO documentary claims to have identified Satoshi.

entry.title: Altcoins bleed, ByBit launches stock index trading, POCHITA soars
entry.summary: Altcoins sink, BTC dominance nears cycle high. BTC in ‘three blind mice’ downtrend. Tron revenue hits record $577m in Q3. ByBit to launch trading of major stock indices. Franklin Templeton launch fund on APT. SWIFT banks to trial digital assets in 2025. Aerodrome hits $1bn TVL on Base. Cronje calls out Aerodrome for copyright. ETH ICO wallet sells $47m. SEC files appeal against Ripple ruling. EIGEN falls 20% on staking rewards FUD. FTX to auction off WLD position. Half of US voters think crypto ‘important’. North Korea ‘infiltrating’ crypto industry. Snowden challenged over SOL centralisation view. Top SEC official on crypto set to depart.

entry.title: DACOM Summit: Fastex CLO Vardan Khachatryan on Crypto Compliance
entry.summary: Fastex Chief Legal Officer Vardan Khachatryan joined Rug Radio creator Mlow at DACOM Summit to discuss how the crypto exchange is advancing compliance, and the regulatory challenges that lie ahead for the sector.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 210 - MIDDLE EAST TENSIONS RISE
entry.summary: Crypto drops as Middle East tensions flare. $500m liquidations in drop. BTC ETFs see largest outflows in a month. Fidelity ETH ETF sees 2nd highest outflow ever. SUI hits 6-month highs, bridge goes live on mainnet. Hashdex set to launch XRP ETF. Wormhole leads altcoin gains after Upbit lists. BTC miners hit record low profits in September Crypto hackers stole $750m in Q3. Telegram has been disclosing IPs since 2018.

entry.title: How Arbitrum is Simplifying Web3 for Web2 Adopters
entry.summary: Arbitrum's Head of Korea, John Park, joined Rug Radio creator Pukerainbow at ArbiVerse to talk about the Ethereum layer-2's strategy in Asia, hackathons, and bringing enterprise clients to its ecosystem.

entry.title: Rep. Tom Emmer Is Confident Crypto Laws Are Coming Soon—No Matter Who Wins the Election
entry.summary: Republican Majority Whip Tom Emmer sat down with Decrypt’s Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano to discuss the state of crypto legislation, Kamala Harris, Fairshake, and more at Messari Mainnet 2024.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 209 - LET UPTOBER BEGIN!
entry.summary: BTC ETFs see inflows for 8 straight days. SUI enters top 20, $110m of unlocks today. SOL weekly DEX volume flips ETH. Firedancer sees very fast TPS on Testnet. ETH gas up 500% in 2 weeks. EIGEN opens at $7bn FDV. FTX creditors vote in favour of restructuring plan. Dell to sell another $1.2bn Dell stock. Metaplanet buys another 107 BTC.Grayscale opens decentralised AI fund to investors. Robinhood allows crypto transfer in EU. Pollak to head Coinbase Wallet & join exec team. Gemini to close in Canada. Japan considers lower cap gains tax on crypto. Ohio bill would make it legal to pay taxes in crypto. Trump project opens whitelist to non-US users. CZ pledges to invest in blockchain companies.

entry.title: Binance CEO Richard Teng Talks Progress on Exchange's Global Regulatory Goals
entry.summary: Decrypt Reporters Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano spoke with Binance CEO Richard Teng about the crypto exchange's progress on establishing a global headquarters, improving its relationships with regulators, and expanding its global presence in the wake of founder Changpeng "CZ" Zhao's jailing in the U.S.
